intro: Cacalia holosericea, commonly known as the silky bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs, contributing to its common name. Cacalia holosericea thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forested areas.
